sentences: Ohvitserid kannavad parema õla all aknelbanti.
Sõduritel oli parema küljes värviline lipp.
context: The word 'parema' in Estonian is the partitive form of 'parem' (right/straight) but when used in military context, it refers to the right shoulder. In combination with terms like õla (shoulder), it describes military decorations or insignia worn on the right shoulder, specifically epaulettes - ornamental shoulder pieces for officers and other military personnel.
